news.title: Scott Farquhar thinks Australia should let AI train for free on creative content. He overlooks one key point
news.summary: Tech Council of Australia chief executive Scott Farquhar says Australia should adopt US-style copyright law. He says all AI usage of mining or searching or going across data is probably illegal under Australian law. “I think that hurts a lot of investment of these companies in Australia,” he says.

news.title: The best fans to keep you cool: 15 tried and tested favourites to beat the heat
news.summary: Summer heatwaves are stretching the bounds of what we think of as summer. Get a good fan and you can dodge the temptation of air conditioning. Save money and carbon by opting for a great fan.

news.title: I tested 42 water bottles to find the best for leaks, looks and sustainability: here are my favourites
news.summary: Water bottles have become a small but significant act of environmental virtue signalling. Not all bottles are created equal, though. Some are insulated, some leak, some weigh as much as a toddler, and some even infuse your water with hydrogen.

news.title: Can’t pay, won’t pay: impoverished streaming services are driving viewers back to piracy
news.summary: As subscription costs rise and choice diminishes on legal sites, film and TV fans are turning to VPNs and illicit streamers. Sweden – home of both Spotify and The Pirate Bay – leading the way.
